hook.text: Walk for an hour and you barely breathe hard. Aerobic metabolism is quiet, efficient, and vast.

buildup.text: It uses oxygen to burn carbs and fat in mitochondria â€” slow but yielding 36 ATP per glucose molecule.

discovery.text: Fat has over twice the energy density of carbs. At low intensity, you can run for hours on fat alone.

twist.text: Push too hard and oxygen demand exceeds supply. Anaerobic systems take over and fatigue rises fast.

climax.text: Endurance training builds more mitochondria and capillaries. You burn fuel more efficiently at every pace.

punchline.text: Aerobic fitness turns your body into a fuel-efficient engine.

quiz.question: How many ATP molecules does aerobic metabolism produce per glucose?
